page.title: 12N.TONBRIDGE FASHION:1939-50
page.content: From an interview with a local retired couple,we learnt the following. During the war,about the only formal wear was uniform,but when on leave the men wore dinner-jackets or tails for dances.When at home,men wore Oxford bags(very wide trousers with turn-ups) with jackets or blazers.The women wore long-waisted dresses and slightly thicker-soled shoes than today.Before the war the women's hairstyles were cloche hats which had a low brim covering the ears.Men's hats were called trilbys and they were very com- mon.In the streets,most men wore suits,usually pin-striped and either black or grey.The women wore long- waisted dresses,floppy hats and shoes with fairly high heels.
